text: Praise to God for His Works During the Exodus
When Israel went out from Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people of a strange language,
\add the\add* hills like ⸤lambs⸥.\f + \fr 114:4 \ft Literally “sons of \fq the \ft flock” \f*
What’s with you, O sea, \add that\add* you fled?
O Jordan, \add that\add* you turned back?
O mountains, \add that\add* you skipped like rams?
At the presence of \add the\add* Lord writhe, O earth,\f + \fr 114:7 \ft Or “O land” \f*
at the presence of the God of Jacob,
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
flinty stone into a spring of water.
